''[[Storge]]'' ({{polytonic|στοργή}} ''storgē'') is natural affection, like that felt by parents for offspring.
 
''[[Storge]]'' ({{polytonic|στοργή}} ''storgē'') is natural affection, like that felt by parents for offspring.
 
 
−
''[[Xenia (Greek)|Xenia]]'' (ξενία ''xenía''), hospitality, was an extremely important practice in Ancient Greece. It was an almost ritualized friendship formed between a host and his guest, who could previously have been strangers. The host fed and provided quarters for the guest, who was expected to repay only with gratitude. The importance of this can be seen throughout [[Greek mythology]]—in particular, Homer's ''[[Iliad]]'' and ''[[Odyssey]]''.
+
''[[Xenia (Greek)|Xenia]]'' (ξενία ''xenía''), hospitality, was an extremely important practice in Ancient Greece. It was an almost ritualized friendship formed between a host and his guest, who could previously have been strangers. The host fed and provided quarters for the guest, who was expected to repay only with gratitude. The importance of this can be seen throughout [[Greek mythology]]—in particular, [[Homer|Homer's]] ''[[Iliad]]'' and ''[[Odyssey]]''.
